column4: Hey guys, when using "xinit" with the "-config <filename>" option as a normal user it tells me I must use a relative path. When I use a path relative to the current directory it tells me it cannot find the file. Anyone have any idea what path I need to be relative to?
probably relative to the cwd where the file is executed from

you mean the cwd in my cli? it tells me it can't find it (Like I said) I run " :~$xinit /usr/bin/wine "C:\Program Files\Conquer 2.0\autopatch.exe" -- :1 -config xorg16.conf" from ~ (xorg16.conf is in ~) and it tells me it cannot find xorg16.conf
no, just because you run the command from your cwd doesn't mean the cwd doesn't change once execution starts.... I would start assuming the location of xinit as the cwd
